subject: Re: [junit] Order of execution for tests
msgSnippet: How rare/cheap does this situation need to be before it isn t worth investing in the better answer? Put the other way, how frequent/expensive does this
messageBody:
How rare/cheap does this situation need to be before it isn't worth investing in the better answer? Put the other way, how frequent/expensive does this situation need to be before it is worth investing in the better answer?

Regards,

Kent

On Jan 4, 2010, at 11:28 AM, Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> On Mon, Jan 4, 2010 at 11:25 AM, Charlie Poole
> <charlie@...>wrote:
>
> > And yet, I get reports of other folks having this interpretation
> > problem all the time. It may be that the problem lies in how they
> > are doing their development.
> >
>
> I don't think so, it's just that
>
> "1 test failed, 9 tests skipped"
>
> is much easier to read and diagnose than
>
> "10 tests failed".
>
> --
> ***Cédric
> *
